org.fujion.codemirror

Class CodeMirrorOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fujion.ancillary.Options
      • org.fujion.codemirror.CodeMirrorOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IOptionMapTransform, IClientTransform
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CodeMirrorXML.XMLOptions

    public class CodeMirrorOptions
extends Options
    Base options common to all CodeMirror components.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  CodeMirrorOptions.InputStyleEnum

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Boolean addModeClass
      When enabled, an extra CSS class will be added to each token, indicating the (inner) mode that produced it, prefixed with "cm-m-".
      String[] allowDropFileTypes
      When set, only files whose type is in the array can be dropped into the editor.
      Boolean autofocus
      Can be used to make CodeMirror focus itself on initialization.
      Boolean coverGutterNextToScrollbar
      When fixedGutter is on, and there is a horizontal scrollbar, by default the gutter will be visible to the left of this scrollbar.
      Integer cursorBlinkRate
      Half-period in milliseconds used for cursor blinking.
      Double cursorHeight
      Determines the height of the cursor.
      Integer cursorScrollMargin
      How much extra space to always keep above and below the cursor when approaching the top or bottom of the visible view in a scrollable document.
      Boolean dragDrop
      Controls whether drag-and-drop is enabled.
      Boolean electricChars
      Configures whether the editor should re-indent the current line when a character is typed that might change its proper indentation (only works if the mode supports indentation).
      Integer firstLineNumber
      At which number to start counting lines.
      Boolean fixedGutter
      Determines whether the gutter scrolls along with the content horizontally (false) or whether it stays fixed (true) during horizontal scrolling.
      Boolean flattenSpans
      By default, CodeMirror will combine adjacent tokens into a single span if they have the same class.
      Integer historyEventDelay
      The period of inactivity (in milliseconds) that will cause a new history event to be started when typing or deleting.
      Integer indentUnit
      How many spaces a block (whatever that means in the edited language) should be indented.
      Boolean indentWithTabs
      Whether, when indenting, the first N*tabSize spaces should be replaced by N tabs.

      Selects the way CodeMirror handles input and focus.

      Whether to show line numbers to the left of the editor.
      String lineSeparator
      Explicitly set the line separator for the editor.
      Boolean lineWiseCopyCut
      When enabled, doing copy or cut when there is no selection will copy or cut the whole lines that have cursors on them.
      Boolean lineWrapping
      Whether CodeMirror should scroll (false) or wrap (true) for long lines.
      Integer maxHighlightLength
      When highlighting long lines, in order to stay responsive, the editor will give up and simply style the rest of the line as plain text when it reaches a certain position.
      protected String mode
      The mode to use.
      Boolean pasteLinesPerSelection
      When pasting something from an external source (not from the editor itself), if the number of lines matches the number of selection, CodeMirror will by default insert one line per selection.
      String placeholder
      Can be used to make content appear in the editor when it is empty and not focused.
      Integer pollInterval
      Indicates how quickly (in milliseconds) CodeMirror should poll its input textarea for changes (when focused).
      Boolean readonly
      This disables editing of the editor content by the user.
      Boolean resetSelectionOnContextMenu
      Controls whether, when the context menu is opened with a click outside of the current selection, the cursor is moved to the point of the click.
      Boolean rtlMoveVisually
      Determines whether horizontal cursor movement through right-to-left (Arabic, Hebrew) text is visual (pressing the left arrow moves the cursor left) or logical (pressing the left arrow moves to the next lower index in the string, which is visually right in right-to-left text).
      String scrollbarStyle
      Chooses a scrollbar implementation.
      Boolean showCursorWhenSelecting
      Whether the cursor should be drawn when a selection is active.
      Boolean smartIndent
      Whether to use the context-sensitive indentation that the mode provides (or just indent the same as the line before).

      A function that, given a special character identified by the specialChars option, produces a DOM node that is used to represent the character.
      Pattern specialChars
      A regular expression used to determine which characters should be replaced by a special placeholder.

      The width of a tab character.

      The maximum number of undo levels that the editor stores.

      Specifies the amount of lines that are rendered above and below the part of the document that's currently scrolled into view.

      Highlighting is done by a pseudo background-thread that will work for workTime milliseconds, and then use timeout to sleep for workDelay milliseconds.
      Integer workTime
      Highlighting is done by a pseudo background-thread that will work for workTime milliseconds, and then use timeout to sleep for workDelay milliseconds.

    • Field Detail

      • addModeClass

        @Option
public Boolean addModeClass
        When enabled, an extra CSS class will be added to each token, indicating the (inner) mode that produced it, prefixed with "cm-m-". For example, tokens from the XML mode will get the cm-m-xml class.

        Default: false

      • allowDropFileTypes

        @Option
public String[] allowDropFileTypes
        When set, only files whose type is in the array can be dropped into the editor. The strings should be MIME types, and will be checked against the type of the File object as reported by the browser.

      • autofocus

        @Option
public Boolean autofocus
        Can be used to make CodeMirror focus itself on initialization.

        Default: false

      • coverGutterNextToScrollbar

        @Option
public Boolean coverGutterNextToScrollbar
        When fixedGutter is on, and there is a horizontal scrollbar, by default the gutter will be visible to the left of this scrollbar. If this option is set to true, it will be covered by an element with class CodeMirror-gutter-filler.

        Default: false

      • cursorBlinkRate

        @Option
public Integer cursorBlinkRate
        Half-period in milliseconds used for cursor blinking. By setting this to zero, blinking can be disabled. A negative value hides the cursor entirely.

        Default: 530

      • cursorHeight

        @Option
public Double cursorHeight
        Determines the height of the cursor. Default is 1, meaning it spans the whole height of the line. For some fonts (and by some tastes) a smaller height (for example 0.85), which causes the cursor to not reach all the way to the bottom of the line, looks better.

        Default: 1.0

      • cursorScrollMargin

        @Option
public Integer cursorScrollMargin
        How much extra space to always keep above and below the cursor when approaching the top or bottom of the visible view in a scrollable document.

        Default: 0

      • dragDrop

        @Option
public Boolean dragDrop
        Controls whether drag-and-drop is enabled.

        Default: true

      • electricChars

        @Option
public Boolean electricChars
        Configures whether the editor should re-indent the current line when a character is typed that might change its proper indentation (only works if the mode supports indentation).

        Default: true

      • firstLineNumber

        @Option
public Integer firstLineNumber
        At which number to start counting lines.

        Default: 1

      • fixedGutter

        @Option
public Boolean fixedGutter
        Determines whether the gutter scrolls along with the content horizontally (false) or whether it stays fixed (true) during horizontal scrolling.

        Default: true

      • flattenSpans

        @Option
public Boolean flattenSpans
        By default, CodeMirror will combine adjacent tokens into a single span if they have the same class. This will result in a simpler DOM tree, and thus perform better. With some kinds of styling (such as rounded corners), this will change the way the document looks. You can set this option to false to disable this behavior.

        Default: true

      • historyEventDelay

        @Option
public Integer historyEventDelay
        The period of inactivity (in milliseconds) that will cause a new history event to be started when typing or deleting.

        Default: 1250

      • indentUnit

        @Option
public Integer indentUnit
        How many spaces a block (whatever that means in the edited language) should be indented.

        Default: 2

      • indentWithTabs

        @Option
public Boolean indentWithTabs
        Whether, when indenting, the first N*tabSize spaces should be replaced by N tabs.

        Default: false

      • inputStyle

        @Option
public CodeMirrorOptions.InputStyleEnum inputStyle
        Selects the way CodeMirror handles input and focus. The core library defines the "textarea" and "contenteditable" input models. On mobile browsers, the default is "contenteditable". On desktop browsers, the default is "textarea". Support for IME and screen readers is better in the "contenteditable" model. The intention is to make it the default on modern desktop browsers in the future.

      • lineNumberFormatter

        @Option
public JavaScript lineNumberFormatter
        A function used to format line numbers. The function is passed the line number, and should return a string that will be shown in the gutter.

      • lineNumbers

        @Option
public Boolean lineNumbers
        Whether to show line numbers to the left of the editor.

      • lineSeparator

        @Option
public String lineSeparator
        Explicitly set the line separator for the editor. By default (value null), the document will be split on CRLFs as well as lone CRs and LFs, and a single LF will be used as line separator in all output (such as getValue). When a specific string is given, lines will only be split on that string, and output will, by default, use that same separator.

      • lineWiseCopyCut

        @Option
public Boolean lineWiseCopyCut
        When enabled, doing copy or cut when there is no selection will copy or cut the whole lines that have cursors on them.

        Default: true

      • lineWrapping

        @Option
public Boolean lineWrapping
        Whether CodeMirror should scroll (false) or wrap (true) for long lines.

        Default: false

      • maxHighlightLength

        @Option
public Integer maxHighlightLength
        When highlighting long lines, in order to stay responsive, the editor will give up and simply style the rest of the line as plain text when it reaches a certain position. You can set this to MaxInt to turn off this behavior.

        Default: 10000

      • mode

        @Option
protected String mode
        The mode to use. When not given, this will default to the first mode that was loaded. It is a string, which either simply names the mode or is a MIME type associated with the mode.

      • pasteLinesPerSelection

        @Option
public Boolean pasteLinesPerSelection
        When pasting something from an external source (not from the editor itself), if the number of lines matches the number of selection, CodeMirror will by default insert one line per selection. You can set this to false to disable that behavior.

        Default: true

      • placeholder

        @Option
public String placeholder
        Can be used to make content appear in the editor when it is empty and not focused. It gives the editor a CodeMirror-empty CSS class whenever it doesn't contain any text.

      • pollInterval

        @Option
public Integer pollInterval
        Indicates how quickly (in milliseconds) CodeMirror should poll its input textarea for changes (when focused). Most input is captured by events, but some things, like IME input on some browsers, don't generate events that allow CodeMirror to properly detect it. Thus, it polls.

        Default: 100.

      • readonly

        @Option
public Boolean readonly
        This disables editing of the editor content by the user. If the special value "nocursor" is given (instead of simply true), focusing of the editor is also disallowed.

        Default: false

      • resetSelectionOnContextMenu

        @Option
public Boolean resetSelectionOnContextMenu
        Controls whether, when the context menu is opened with a click outside of the current selection, the cursor is moved to the point of the click.

        Default: true

      • rtlMoveVisually

        @Option
public Boolean rtlMoveVisually
        Determines whether horizontal cursor movement through right-to-left (Arabic, Hebrew) text is visual (pressing the left arrow moves the cursor left) or logical (pressing the left arrow moves to the next lower index in the string, which is visually right in right-to-left text). Default: false on Windows, and true on other platforms.

      • scrollbarStyle

        @Option
public String scrollbarStyle
        Chooses a scrollbar implementation. The default is "native", showing native scrollbars. The core library also provides the "null" style, which completely hides the scrollbars. Addons can implement additional scrollbar models.

        Default: "native"

      • showCursorWhenSelecting

        @Option
public Boolean showCursorWhenSelecting
        Whether the cursor should be drawn when a selection is active.

        Default: false

      • smartIndent

        @Option
public Boolean smartIndent
        Whether to use the context-sensitive indentation that the mode provides (or just indent the same as the line before).

        Default: true

      • specialCharPlaceholder

        @Option
public JavaScript specialCharPlaceholder
        A function that, given a special character identified by the specialChars option, produces a DOM node that is used to represent the character.

        Default: A red dot (•) is shown, with a title tooltip to indicate the character code.

      • specialChars

        @Option
public Pattern specialChars
        A regular expression used to determine which characters should be replaced by a special placeholder. Mostly useful for non-printing special characters.

        Default: [␀--­؜​-‏  ﻿]

      • tabSize

        @Option
public Integer tabSize
        The width of a tab character.

        Default: 4

      • undoDepth

        @Option
public Integer undoDepth
        The maximum number of undo levels that the editor stores. Note that this includes selection change events.

        Default: 200

      • viewportMargin

        @Option
public Integer viewportMargin
        Specifies the amount of lines that are rendered above and below the part of the document that's currently scrolled into view. This affects the amount of updates needed when scrolling, and the amount of work that such an update does. You should usually leave it at its default, 10. Can be set to MaxInt to make sure the whole document is always rendered, and thus the browser's text search works on it. This will have bad effects on performance of big documents.

        Default: 10

      • workDelay

        @Option
public Integer workDelay
        Highlighting is done by a pseudo background-thread that will work for workTime milliseconds, and then use timeout to sleep for workDelay milliseconds. You can change these options to make the highlighting more or less aggressive.

        Default: 300

      • workTime

        @Option
public Integer workTime
        Highlighting is done by a pseudo background-thread that will work for workTime milliseconds, and then use timeout to sleep for workDelay milliseconds. You can change these options to make the highlighting more or less aggressive.

        Default: 200

    • Constructor Detail

      • CodeMirrorOptions

        public CodeMirrorOptions(String mode)
        Create options instance with specified mode.
        Parameters:
        mode - Desired mode.

                            String command)
        Binds a key combination to a registered command.
        Parameters:
        key - Key combination mnemonic.
        command - Name of registered command.
        Returns:
        The previous key binding (command or JavaScript object), or null if none.

      • addKeyBinding

        public Object addKeyBinding(String key,
                            JavaScript javascript)
        Binds a key combination to a JavaScript function.
        Parameters:
        key - Key combination mnemonic.
        javascript - JavaScript code to be invoked.
        Returns:
        The previous key binding (command or JavaScript object), or null if none.

      • getKeyBinding

        public Object getKeyBinding(String key)
        Returns the current key binding.
        Parameters:
        key - Key combination mnemonic.
        Returns:
        The existing key binding (command or JavaScript object), or null if none.

      • removeKeyBinding

        public Object removeKeyBinding(String key)
        Removes the current key binding, if any.
        Parameters:
        key - Key combination mnemonic.
        Returns:
        The previous key binding (command or JavaScript object), or null if none.
